posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
I’ve gotten the repository on my local machine just fine, but VSCode seems convinced that the `edu.first` imports don’t exist. You didn’t say how you created your project. An easy way to add libraries in VSCode is to hit the plus sign in the Referenced Libraries area. That adds to the `settings.json` file.  

![Image](https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/4X/5/5/b/55b6ab8d59543a07e9ed7d1b80fdf4045211401f.png?base62-sha1=cefX8Tz3sFz9kNR9bRcqsCu4Aaz)  
![Settings](https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/4X/5/5/b/55b6ab8d59543a07e9ed7d1b80fdf4045211401f.png?base62-sha1=cefX8Tz3sFz9kNR9bRcqsCu4Aaz)

posts.name: Khiry Rheubottom
posts.cooked:
Here’s the step-by-step explanation and the final answer: **Step-by-Step Explanation:** 1. **Remove HTML Tags:** - Strip out `

` tags and any other HTML structure while preserving the content's integrity. 2. **Identify Unnecessary Elements:** - Remove `

` wrappers that enclose image and metadata sections without essential context. 3. **Simplify Descriptions:** - Condense explanations without losing the core message or intent behind each point raised in the original text. 4. **Ensure Coherence:** - Maintain logical flow between paragraphs to enhance readability and comprehension. --- **Cleaned-Up Text:** Thank you for your response! Unfortunately, I'm encountering an issue where the application can't locate the `libNotFound` file. Could you please guide me on which additional libraries I might need to include in my project setup? Previously, I've successfully added libraries directly from Maven for my smaller projects, but this particular case is proving challenging since I'm unsure about the exact libraries VSCode expects. After attempting to search the API documentation for the relevant classes (`edu.wpi.first.shuffleboard.api.*`), it appears these classes and their members aren't listed there. I wonder if I'm searching in the correct location.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: so i tried to dig into the wpilib api docs but found the packages involved aren't part of wpilib yet. those are the api docs from wpilib the shuffleboard plugin api is part of shuffleboard you can get those javadoc here jfrog

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: This Shuffleboard.jar appears to be what you're looking for. The source code has been updated since the release of the jar file. I think ShuffleBoard might be retired soon, so maybe consider alternative approaches.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
I'm not sure why VS Code isn't finding the API; it should pull it from the project and build it locally if it hasn't been built yet. The API references include:
- `shuffleboard/example-plugins/custom-data-and-widget/custom-data-and-widget.gradle` at commit `68a14d7`
- `shuffleboard/api/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/shuffleboard/api`

These references suggest the issue may stem from custom build.gradle file names used by Shuffleboard, potentially confusing the VS Code Java plugin. Testing shows it works in IntelliJ, though.
